data.title: Launching on linux 14.04
data.body:
after fresh install:
the commands `/usr/local/bin/atom` or  just `atom` don't launch the editor.
`/usr/local/bin/atom -n` works. Seems like a bug.

Updated.

I think, it's related only for a first time launching.

data.title: Ctrl+v is double-pasting
data.body:
If I type some text, highlight it and copy it with <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>c</kbd>, then if I go elsewhere to paste it with <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>v</kbd>, it pastes it twice:

![output](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/153459/2893046/4dd5d63e-d544-11e3-89fb-b0508ed64317.gif)

It is copying to the clipboard properly, because if I use choose Edit -> Paste from the GUI, it pastes fine.

This is on Ubuntu 12.04 64-bit.  `atom --version` is 1254425.

data.title: Fix markdown typo
data.body: Well that's embarassing ... there was a typo in the markdown in my PR. This fixes that.

data.title: gyp - rolling back install [error]
data.body:
After I've pulled from here #1936,

I get an new error:

```
gyp info it worked if it ends with ok
gyp info using node-gyp@0.12.2
gyp info using node@0.10.26 | win32 | x64
gyp http GET https://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist/v0.11.10/node-v0.11.10.tar.gz
gyp http 200 https://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist/v0.11.10/node-v0.11.10.tar.gz
gyp WARN install got an error, rolling back install
gyp
```

Then it takes me back to the input. What can I do?

Regards,
Jan

data.title: Add Git for Windows as Windows build requirement
data.body: Windows instructions were missing "Git" prerequisite (users were getting "Git not found in PATH" errors from npm).

data.title: New Icon
data.body: Is there a way to get the old icon back easily? This new one is disgusting and hurts my eyes D:

There aren't any instructions in the Readme on how to actually run Atom once it's been built, and I've looked in a few obvious places for something to run, but couldn't find anything.

**How do you run Atom on Windows after it's been built?**

data.title: Build under Windows [apm error]
data.body:
Hey guys,

I try to build the Atom editor under windows. I have followed all steps at these guide: https://github.com/atom/atom#building

Now when I am input `script/build` it shows me an error:
`The command "apm" is either incorrectly written or could not be found.`

What can I do/What i make wrong? (I am using Windows 8)

Regards,
Jan

data.title: If atom.sh has non-zero exit show errors captured by nohup. Refers to #1814
data.body:
This is the only way I could figure out how to get the exit code from `nohup` _and_ still suppress output whilst notifying of the actual error.

EDIT: BTW this is useful because `atom` just silently fails if something goes wrong.

data.title: Keyboard shortcut: Add selection Above/Below
data.body:
By default this shortcut is `control-shift-up` or `control-shift-down`

Yet this is a default  OSX shortcut for Mission Control / Application Windows with the slow modifier being shift

![screen shot 2014-05-06 at 1 15 47 pm 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5893112/2892147/baebbffa-d539-11e3-9e3c-725e473a97da.png)

data.title: Use virtualenv python when building
data.body:
On my Linux (Arch 3.14.2-1-ARCH, 64 bit), `/usr/bin/python` is a symlink to Python 3.4.0.  So when I run `script/build`, I get the following error:

```
gyp ERR! configure error 
gyp ERR! stack Error: Python executable "python" is v3.4.0, which is not supported by gyp.
gyp ERR! stack You can pass the --python switch to point to Python >= v2.5.0 & < 3.0.0.
gyp ERR! stack     at failPythonVersion (/tmp/atom/build/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/lib/configure.js:108:14)
gyp ERR! stack     at /tmp/atom/build/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/lib/configure.js:97:9
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.exithandler (child_process.js:645:7)
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.EventEmitter.emit (events.js:98:17)
gyp ERR! stack     at maybeClose (child_process.js:753:16)
gyp ERR! stack     at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:820:5)
gyp ERR! System Linux 3.14.2-1-ARCH
gyp ERR! command "node" "/tmp/atom/build/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js" "rebuild"
gyp ERR! cwd /tmp/atom/apm/node_modules/atom-package-manager/node_modules/keytar
gyp ERR! node -v v0.10.28
gyp ERR! node-gyp -v v0.13.0
```

I get the same error when running the build from inside a Python 2 virtualenv, even though `which python` now points to a Python 2 executable.

I fixed the error temporarily by moving the `/usr/bin/python` symlink to `/usr/bin/python2`, but heaven knows what other effects this might have on my system.

Do you have any reason?

https://www.atom.io/api/packages/feedback/versions/0.30.0/tarball

Currently errors when building ubuntu

data.title: Ubuntu 14.04 64bits running failed
data.body:
Atom build well on Ubuntu 14.04 64 bits.
But trying to run it give an libudev error, which you can easily solve with:
``ln -s /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libudev.so /usr/lib/libudev.so.0`

After that, running atom return this output:

```
--2014-05-06 17:50:56--  http://54.249.141.255:1127/post
Connecting to 54.249.141.255:1127... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: unspecified
Saving to: ‘/dev/fd/3’

     0K                                                        0,00 =0s

2014-05-06 17:50:59 (0,00 B/s) - ‘/dev/fd/3’ saved [0]
```

data.title: Fix link to API in README
Pasting clipboard created from a multiple selection doesn't keep the track of original selections
data.body:
When a copy/paste is made when there's many selections, Atom fails to preserve the selections at paste time. 

This is how Sublime text behave in that case: 
![Sublime reference](http://s3.postimg.org/gp7bx5xir/sublime.gif)

This is how atom behave: 
![Atom reference](http://s27.postimg.org/sivs2oi3n/atom.gif)

This behavior should only be available if the number of selections is the same between the copy and the paste, in every other cases Sublime Text paste the clipboard in the same way Atom does, it paste the whole clipboard at each selection's position.

data.title: Updates Jasmine link
data.body:
:memo:
Updates Jasmine link in CONTRIBUTING.md

data.title: Show code necessary to create emoji
data.body: Touch screens without `:hover` are unable to see the tooltip.

data.title: Use SHA-1 as prerelease for dev builds
data.body:
Not having a valid semver version in dev builds causes certain `apm` commands to not work.

So instead of using `abcdef12` as the development version, we should use something like `0.93.0-abcdef12` to make it a valid semver string where the pre-release segment is the partial SHA-1 of the commit built.

data.title: Update build requirements
data.body: Make it easier for people to build Atom from scratch.

data.title: Refine scrollbar interactions
data.body:
The previous editor had a host of scrollbar-related issues that are addressed in this PR:
- The horizontal scrollbar would obscure the last line.
- The vertical scrollbar would obscure the last character.
- The horizontal scrollbar didn't extend the entire width of the editor.
- The dummy scrollbars were always 15px wide rather than the true width of a scrollbar based on the stylesheet.
- The dummy scrollbars remained visible even when content was not scrollable, interfering with mouse clicks.
- Scrollbars didn't respond to stylesheet changes until they were hidden and redisplayed.

data.title: Fix split option errors
data.body:
The pane sibling methods were throwing errors when the left or rightmost sibling was a `PaneAxis` instead of a `Pane`.

Closes #1917

data.title: New brand assets
data.body:
:warning: Don't merge until Tuesday :warning:

This adds the new logo.

data.title: Emit Git status results in chunks
data.body:
Looks like really large repositories have issues sending across a giant status object, we can just stream them back in chunks like the fuzzy finder does.

Support ticket 86eddc26cb5011e38ee058b670f95585

data.title: Dialogs are closed when Atom loses focus
data.body:
Halp reports:
- support/a3fbafb2d0c011e3855fe03a98b207e5
- support/4068a4a4d08f11e39bd83f5315db0b57

Related Issues
- https://github.com/atom/feedback/issues/22
- https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/issues/37

> If you have opened up the Command Palette (Command-Shift-P) in Atom v.0.92.0, and then switch to another app, say the Mac OS X Terminal app to run something you've been working on, the Command Palette is gone when you switch back (this is also true of this "Send us feedback" drop-down pane). It would be preferable if, on switching back to the Atom app v.0.92.0, that the Command Palette were still open where you left it.

I've noticed this myself, but never fund it particularly annoying. Also, some other dialogs are affected by this as well, such as the fuzzy finder. Unsure if this is something that's handled on a per-package basis or in Atom core, so opened an issue here. :pizza: 
- It seems that SublimeText doesn't have consistent behavior with these dialogs -- the command palette is closed similar to Atom, but the fuzzy finder is not (it stays open even after the app loses focus).

data.title: Triggering Markdown preview with split panes throws an error
data.body:
Reported via Twitter: https://twitter.com/sbellware/status/462009964634972160

Steps to reproduce:
1. Start Atom
2. `cmd-k right` to split panes
3. `cmd-k down` to split panes again
4. The pane configuration should now be: one pane open on the left, two on the right
5. Position the cursor into the pane on the left
6. Trigger Markdown preview

A `Uncaught TypeError: Object #<PaneAxis> has no method 'itemForUri'` will be logged in the console.

![screen shot 2014-05-02 at 11 18 41 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/38924/2861200/cec732e6-d1da-11e3-8156-6a2732150a3e.png)
